LanguageData.ForceNakedTooltip:
If enabled, removes all apparel when applying gear, leaving pawn naked.
Age verification required.
LanguageData.ForceOnlySelectedTooltip:
If enabled, all existing/vanilla gear will be stripped before applying custom gear. Ensures pawns only wear what you specify, preventing vanilla/custom mixing.
Recommended: Enable for full control.
LanguageData.WeightMechanicsTooltip: Weight mechanics: In RimWorld, gear weight acts as selection weight, not 100% selection. Higher weight gear is prioritized but not guaranteed.
LanguageData.UnsavedChangesMessage: You have unsaved changes. Save them?

LanguageData.ForceIgnoreTooltip: Force remove conflicting apparel/weapons and ignore budget limits. Pawns will attempt to equip all possible items from config list, allowing you to bypass restrictions and always create god-tier units.

LanguageData.PawnGroupGuideContent:
[Group Types]
‚Ä¢ Combat: Battle groups for raids ‚Ä¢ Trader: Trade groups, must include traders ‚Ä¢ Settlement: Settlement garrisons ‚Ä¢ Peaceful: Peaceful visitors
[Weights]
Commonality determines selection probability.
[Points]
Limits maximum combat power. Usually set very high for storyteller control.
[Role Configuration]
‚Ä¢ Options: General combatants ‚Ä¢ Traders: Merchant core (Trader groups only) ‚Ä¢ Carriers: Pack animals/porters ‚Ä¢ Guards: Escorts protecting merchants
Warnings: ‚Ä¢ Deleting all Combat groups prevents raids ‚Ä¢ Trader groups without Traders fail to generate
LanguageData.ConfirmCreateSettlement:
Faction established. Create settlement now?
(Settlements required for faction to appear in-game)

LanguageData.NameCannotBeOnlySpecialChars: Name cannot contain only special characters
LanguageData.RefreshTooltip: Refresh all UI caches including faction lists, kind lists and icon caches.
LanguageData.FactionAlreadyExistsTooltip: This faction already exists in game. Only one instance per faction template. To modify existing faction, use "Faction Edit" feature.

You can change this later in Mod Settings.

LanguageData.WikiMascotTip: Sly raccoon - Click to view on Steam Workshop
LanguageData.Wiki_Principles_Content:
[How does this mod work?]
Simply put: After you configure the mod, when the game generates new characters (enemies, caravans, defenders, etc.), the mod quietly replaces their original gear with your custom gear.
[When does it take effect?] ‚Ä¢ New enemy raids ‚Ä¢ New caravans arriving ‚Ä¢ Settlement defenders refreshing ‚Ä¢ Reinforcements, visitors, etc.
‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Characters already on the map will NOT change!
[Simple Mode vs Advanced Mode]
üìç Simple Mode: Adjust equipment probabilities using sliders, as easy as adjusting volume. Good for: Quickly adjusting faction gear style without worrying about details.
üìç Advanced Mode: Directly specify what characters must wear and use. Good for: Precise control, like "All soldiers must wear power armor".
[What is Budget?]
Each pawn kind has a "budget". Equipment exceeding the budget won't be generated.
Example: A tribal warrior with 500 silver budget won't get an 800 silver weapon.
Want full customization? Increase the budget, or enable the "Force Ignore" option.
[Be careful with Force Options!] ‚Ä¢ Force Ignore: Ignores budget, may create overpowered characters, breaking game balance ‚Ä¢ Force Only Selected: Remove all vanilla gear, must ensure you have complete equipment configured
[Adjust Item Generation Probability] ‚Ä¢ Weight: Equipment probability, click specific item to see slider, adjust to desired probability.
[What are Item Pools?]
Put multiple items into a pool, randomly draw one when generating. Benefit: Different enemy equipment each time, more challenging.
There are 4 pools you can configure separately, draw probability determined by weights.
LanguageData.Wiki_Terminology_Content:
[Core Concepts You Must Know]
üé≠ PawnKind The "classes" in the game: Pirate Gunner, Tribal Warrior, Empire Knight, etc. Each pawn kind has its own equipment preferences and stats.
üè¥ Faction A force composed of multiple pawn kinds: Pirates, Tribals, Empire, Caravans, etc. A faction has many pawn kinds.
üîß Group Every faction generates units with a "group", such as "Combat", "Trader", "Settlement", etc. A faction has many groups. You can add different pawn kinds or mechanoids to groups.
üí∞ Budget How much silver each pawn kind can spend on equipment. Exceed the budget? Won't be generated.
üé≤ Selection Mode ‚Ä¢ AlwaysTake: Always equipped ‚Ä¢ RandomChance: Based on luck ‚Ä¢ FromPool: Randomly draw one
üõ°Ô∏è Force Options ‚Ä¢ Force Ignore: Ignore budget, force equip ‚Ä¢ Force Naked: Strip first, then equip your selections ‚Ä¢ Force Only Selected: Remove all vanilla gear
üîß Item Properties ‚Ä¢ Material: Steel, cloth, plasteel, etc. Affects stats ‚Ä¢ Quality: Awful ‚Üí Legendary, affects stats and price
üíä Hediff (Health State) Can force add states to characters: bionic limbs, drugs, diseases, etc. Use: All archotech cyborgs!
üèòÔ∏è Group Types (Select pawn types to spawn here) ‚Ä¢ Combat: Enemies that attack you / Allies that support you ‚Ä¢ Trader: Caravans for trading ‚Ä¢ Settlement: Settlement defenders ‚Ä¢ Peaceful: Peaceful visitors
‚öôÔ∏è Tech Level Primitive ‚Üí Medieval ‚Üí Industrial ‚Üí Spacer ‚Üí Ultra High-tech equipment won't work for low-tech factions
ü¶† Xenotype Only available with Biotech DLC: Sanguophages, pigmen, mole people, and other genetically modified humans. Can set probabilities for different xenotypes in each faction.
LanguageData.Wiki_Workflow_Content:
[Quick Start - Workflow]
1. Want to quickly adjust faction gear? Follow these steps! ‚Ä¢ Create Preset Click "Preset Manager" ‚Üí New ‚Üí Name it (e.g., "Enhanced Tribals") ‚Ä¢ Select Faction and Pawn Kind Left side: Select faction (Pirates/Tribals/Empire...) Middle: Select pawn kind (Gunner/Warrior/Knight...) ‚Ä¢ Configure Gear Simple Mode: Drag sliders to adjust equipment probabilities Advanced Mode: Click "Add" to select specific equipment ‚Ä¢ Save and Apply Click Save! Then wait for new enemies to arrive, see the effect!
Tip: Try Simple Mode first, Advanced Mode gives precise control over each item.
2. Want to adjust faction group generated pawn kinds? (Add Animals/Mechanoids/Non-Faction Members) ‚Ä¢ Click Edit Faction Click "Edit Faction" ‚Üí Dropdown find the group to adjust (e.g., "Combat #1") ‚Ä¢ Select Pawn Kinds Middle: Select pawn kinds to remove/add (Warriors/Animals/Mechanoids...) ‚Ä¢ Edit Group Adjust the group's pawn kinds/count/weights, etc. ‚Ä¢ Save and Apply Click Save! Then wait for new enemies to arrive, see the group effect!
[Advanced Play]
1. Random but Themed (Item Pools) Different enemy equipment each time? ‚Ä¢ Advanced Mode ‚Üí Click "Item Pool" ‚Ä¢ Pool1 put in multiple weapons ‚Ä¢ Set weights (higher = more likely to be selected) ‚Ä¢ Randomly draws one when generating
2. All Cyborgs Want enemies to be all mechanically enhanced? ‚Ä¢ Advanced Mode ‚Üí "Add Forced Hediff" ‚Ä¢ Select "Bionic Leg", "Bionic Arm", etc. ‚Ä¢ Set 100% probability
3. Batch Apply Want one configuration for all pawn kinds in a faction? ‚Ä¢ Configure one pawn kind ‚Ä¢ Right-click ‚Üí Copy ‚Ä¢ Select other pawn kinds ‚Üí Right-click ‚Üí Paste ‚Ä¢ Done!
4. Live Preview Not sure about the effect? Click "Preview" button, see generation results directly! Adjust until satisfied.
5. Export Preset to Share Configured something good to share with friends? ‚Ä¢ Preset Manager ‚Üí Export ‚Ä¢ Copy the generated string ‚Ä¢ Send to friends ‚Ä¢ Friends can import and use
[Practice]
Task: Add Powerful Mechanoid Boss to Faction Configuration: ‚Ä¢ Top Left - Faction Edit ‚Ä¢ Dropdown find Faction Group Edit ‚Ä¢ Select specific group type, such as (Combat #1) ‚Ä¢ Add Mechanoids.
Task: Strengthen Tribal Forces Goal: Make tribal enemies wear better equipment Configuration: ‚Ä¢ Increase budget (tribals are originally poor) ‚Ä¢ Simple Mode: Increase ranged and melee weights ‚Ä¢ Or Advanced Mode: Directly add iron swords, leather armor
Task: Create Elite Enemies Goal: A faction with all legendary equipment Configuration: ‚Ä¢ Advanced Mode: Set each item to "Legendary" quality ‚Ä¢ Enable "Force Ignore" ‚Ä¢ Enable "Force Only Selected" ‚Ä¢ Add strongest equipment
LanguageData.Wiki_Notes_Content:
[Must Know!]
‚è∞ Save! Save! ‚Ä¢ Save takes effect immediately, no game restart needed ‚Ä¢ Only affects newly spawned enemies/caravans/defenders ‚Ä¢ Enemies already on the map won't change!
Want to know the effect? Click "Preview" button, see directly!
[Common Issues]
If gear modifications don't take effect, please check:
- Whether it conforms to [Budget] limits - Whether successfully saved to [Preset] - Whether [Force Ignore] is enabled - Whether [Force Only Selected] is enabled
If pawn collapses after spawning, please check:
- Whether carried items exceed reasonable [Mass/Bulk] - Whether severe [Debuff] was added in the Hediff menu
üîß Can't select items? ‚Ä¢ Requires specific DLC ‚Ä¢ Is it disabled by other mods ‚Ä¢ Tech level too high
üîß Compatibility with xxx mod? ‚Ä¢ Place that incompatible mod after this mod in load order.
[Force Options Warning]
‚ö†Ô∏è Force Ignore: May create "god-tier" enemies, game becomes too easy ‚ö†Ô∏è Force Naked: Remember to configure enough clothes, otherwise truly naked ‚ö†Ô∏è Force Only Selected: Make sure your custom list has items first!
[Backup!]
‚Ä¢ First use export a vanilla preset ‚Ä¢ Major modifications export a backup ‚Ä¢ Test before sharing with friends
[Compatibility]
‚úÖ These mods tested for compatibility: ‚Ä¢ Combat Extended (CE) ‚Ä¢ Vanilla Expanded series ‚Ä¢ Ideology DLC ‚Ä¢ Biotech DLC
‚ö†Ô∏è Mod load order: Harmony ‚Üí Large Mods ‚Üí This Mod ‚Üí Small Patches
[Questions?] Contact me:
‚Ä¢ Steam Workshop https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3670833973
‚Ä¢ GitHub https://github.com/yancy22737-sudo/FactionGearCustomizer
‚Ä¢ QQ Group 984338429

LanguageData.MassCriticalWarning: Critical overweight: {0}/{1} kg - May cause inability to move!
LanguageData.BulkCriticalWarning: Critical overbulk: {0}/{1} - May cause inability to move!
LanguageData.InventoryOverweightWarning: Warning: Inventory critically overweight, pawn may be unable to move!
LanguageData.HediffWarning_ConsciousnessZero: Will cause pawn to lose consciousness and be unable to act
LanguageData.HediffWarning_MovingZero: Will cause pawn to be unable to move
LanguageData.HediffWarning_MovingLow: Will severely reduce pawn moving capability
LanguageData.HediffWarning_ManipulationZero: Will cause pawn to be unable to manipulate items
LanguageData.HediffWarning_ManipulationLow: Will severely reduce pawn manipulation capability
